body: I think so, I've used `make` commands for Sphinx document creation on this setup

@rvUnipart Can you run this command?

```
python -c 'import subprocess; subprocess.run(["make", "--help"], check=True)'
```

Ah yes, same error message:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "C:\Users\Vizer\Anaconda3\envs\mlflowpipelines\lib\subprocess.py", line 488, in run
    with Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs) as process:
  File "C:\Users\Vizer\Anaconda3\envs\mlflowpipelines\lib\subprocess.py", line 800, in __init__
    restore_signals, start_new_session)
  File "C:\Users\Vizer\Anaconda3\envs\mlflowpipelines\lib\subprocess.py", line 1207, in _execute_child
    startupinfo)
FileNotFoundError: [WinError 2] The system cannot find the file specified

Also if I just run `make --help` in Anaconda terminal I get:

'make' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
@dbczumar It might be helpful to check if `make` is available and throw an error with a helpful message if it's not.

I installed chocolately (non-admin) from here https://docs.chocolatey.org/en-us/choco/setup#non-administrative-install
then ran `choco install make` and `make --help` confirms it's installed.

Going back and running `mlflow pipelines run --profile local` again now fully completes (albeit with some warnings):

Many thanks for the help harupy :)
@rvUnipart Awesome! Can we close this issue?

I was trying out MLflow pipelines yesterday and I faced the same problem. I see @dbczumar already merged a PR to solve this problem. Maybe also consider adding this note in the [Regression Template](https://github.com/mlflow/mlp-regression-template#installation-instructions) so it is clear everywhere.
